data.title: Yellow Line Metro Bangalore: Stations, Routes and Timings 2024
data.meta_description: The Yellow Metro Line of Bangalore is a soon to be open metro line which will connect areas of BTM to Electronics city. Here’s all you need to know.
data.text:
With fares starting as cheap as Rs. 10, Bangalore’s own Metro aka Namma Metro’s upcoming Yellow Line extension will make commuting in Bangalore easier and more affordable. The Yellow Line Metro Bangalore promises to unite crucial areas within Bangalore, extending its reach from Bommasandra to the bustling hub of R.V Road. Let's take a look at this soon-to-be-open East-West extension of the Namma Metro.

The Yellow Line of Bangalore Metro is an under-construction part of the metro rail network for the city. You can plan your commute using a Bangalore metro map yellow line to see which stations are along the route. Now, let’s take a look at this soon-to-be-open East-West extension of the Namma Metro.

The Namma Bangalore Metro Yellow Line

The Yellow Line, stretching over an expanse of approximately 18.82 km, will host 16 strategically positioned stations. Bangalore's much-anticipated Yellow Line Metro route is inching closer to completion, expected to be operational by December 2024. Here is the list of stations on the Yellow line of the Bangalore Metro Map

R.V. Road (Interchange station with the Green Line)

Ragigudda

Jayadeva Hospital (Future interchange station with the Pink Line)

BTM Layout

Central Silk Board (Future interchange station with the Blue Line)

Bommanahalli

Hongasandra

Kudlu Gate metro station

Singasandra

Hosa Road

Beratena Agrahara

Electronic City

Konnapana Agrahara

Husker Road

Hebbagodi

Metro station near Bommasandra (Initial planned terminal station)

Exciting News for Commuters: Namma Metro Yellow Line to Extend 20.5 km to Hosur by The End of 2024

In June 2022, the Karnataka government approved an extension of the Bengaluru Metro’s Yellow Line from its current last stop at Bommasandra to Hosur in Tamil Nadu. The Yellow Line of the Bangalore Metro will boast 16 stations, connecting areas like Electronic City and Jayadeva Hospital. The Yellow Line, which is 19 km long and runs from RV Road to Bommasandra, is set to be up and running by the end of 2024. The proposed extension will add another 20.5 km to the line, with 11.5 km in Karnataka and 8.8 km in Tamil Nadu.

The Tamil Nadu government is also on board, believing that the metro link will spur growth and development in Hosur. They’ve even set aside Rs 75 lakh for a feasibility study, the tender for which is likely to open in December 2024. This is a big deal for the Yellow Line, a key metro route that connects South Bengaluru to Electronics City, where major companies like Infosys and Biocon are located.

Getting around Yellow Line Metro Route Bangalore Timings, Frequency, and Fares

Need to use the Yellow Line in Bangalore’s Metro? While Bangalore Metro timings typically run from 5 am to 11 pm on weekdays, it's important to double-check for any updates or changes. Here’s a quick rundown of the train timings, frequency, and ticket fares.

Metro Timings and Frequency

The Yellow Line of Bangalore’s Namma Metro has different operating hours on weekdays, weekends, and holidays.

Mainly, the metro timings in Bangalore depend on the day of the week. Remember, these times can change, so it’s a good idea to check the Bangalore Metro website or app for the most current info.

Ticket Prices & Smart Card Benefits: Travel Bangalore without Spending Too Much

Ticket prices start at just Rs. 10 for trips up to 2 km and go up to Rs. 60 for distances over 24 km.

The Bangalore Metro also offers a smart card system for an even more convenient and cost-effective journey. You can purchase a smart card at any metro station for a one-time fee of Rs. 50. After that, simply recharge it online or at any station, and your fare will be automatically deducted each time you travel. You'll also enjoy a 10% discount on fares and free rides for kids under 5 and seniors over 65.

Residential Areas Near Bangalore Metro Yellow Line

With Bangalore's Yellow Line Metro coming soon, exciting changes are in store for nearby residential areas. Here are four ideal localities for home-seekers–

1. Electronic City Metro Station: Integrated Living

Home to a variety of IT companies, Electronic City offers a combination of work and leisure. The upcoming Yellow Line Metro aims to provide improved transport links. With educational, medical, and retail facilities nearby, residents can find most essentials within reach.

2. Central Silk Board: Urban Life, Simplified

Central Silk Board is well-connected, making daily commutes easier. The forthcoming Yellow Line Metro is set to further improve mobility. The presence of schools, malls, and hospitals ensures that residents have easy access to essential services and amenities.

3. Singasandra: Suburban Comfort with Connectivity

Close to Electronic City, Singasandra offers a peaceful suburban feel without sacrificing accessibility. The imminent Yellow Line Metro promises better travel options. With schools and healthcare facilities nearby, and natural landmarks like Chikka Begur Lake, it offers a balanced living environment.

4. Jayadeva Hospital Area: Comprehensive City Living

This locale offers more than just medical facilities. Schools, shopping centres, and varied amenities are nearby, ensuring a balanced lifestyle. The upcoming Yellow Line Metro is set to enhance connectivity, catering to the practical needs of its residents.

The Yellow Line Metro in Bangalore is will make it more easier for you to travel in Bangalore. Thinking of living near this line? It’s a good idea, but finding the right home can be tricky. There’s so much to consider, and it can be overwhelming. That’s where NoBroker can help. You can use the NoBroker app. But that’s not all, the NoBroker app even lets you find homes near Bangalore’s Yellow Line metro which fit your budget.
